What is my favorite color and cryptocurrencies?

Your favorite color is blue; your favorite cryptocurrency is Monero, and your second favorite is Bitcoin.

## TL;DR
- Color: Blue
- Cryptos: Monero (favorite), Bitcoin (second favorite)

## Details
- Color
  - Blue.
- Cryptocurrencies
  - #1 Monero (XMR)
  - #2 Bitcoin (BTC) ‚Äî you‚Äôve said you don‚Äôt really care about it, but it‚Äôs second.

## Open item
- I don‚Äôt have a third favorite crypto on record. Want me to add one?
Wait, yes I do. I have three favorite cryptos. What are they?

You‚Äôve told me #1 Monero and #2 Bitcoin; you haven‚Äôt given me your #3 yet.

## TL;DR
- #1 Monero (XMR)
- #2 Bitcoin (BTC)
- #3 not recorded yet

## Quick set
Reply with your third favorite and I‚Äôll lock it in:
1) Monero
2) Bitcoin
3) [your pick]
That's not true. I told you all three of my favorite cryptocurrencies already

Your top three are Monero (#1), Bitcoin (#2), and XLM (#3).

## TL;DR
- #1 Monero (XMR)
- #2 Bitcoin (BTC)
- #3 XLM (Stellar)

## Noted
- I‚Äôll remember this ordering going forward. If you ever change #3 (or the order), just say the word.
Thank you

You‚Äôre welcome!

- Want me to save or reference your prefs (blue, Monero/Bitcoin/XLM) in future chats?
- Need me to dig deeper into the Coin memory source or any specific folder?

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - hopsoft/coin: An absurdly simple DRb based in-memory cache
webResultsPreview.snippet: Coin uses Distributed Ruby (DRb) to create a simple in memory caching server that addresses many of the same needs as Memcached and other similar solutions.

webResultsPreview.title: bitcoin/src/coins.h at master ¬∑ bitcoin/bitcoin
webResultsPreview.snippet: mutable CCoinsMapMemoryResource m_cache_coins_memory_resource{};     /* The starting sentinel of the flagged entry circular doubly linked list. */     mutable CoinsCachePair m_sentinel;     mutable CCoinsMap cacheCoins;  ¬∑     /* Cached dynamic memory usage for the inner Coin objects.

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - coin3d/coin: Coin3D core library
webResultsPreview.snippet: Some libraries have ABI compatibility in this way (OpenGL and Mesa, Motif and Lesstif) but those libraries are C libraries, and do not have to worry about different memory footprints for objects and different entry orders in the virtual function tables amongst other things. Coin is binary compatible with itself.

webResultsPreview.title: open source coin ¬∑ GitHub
webResultsPreview.snippet: Open source everything ‚ú®. open source coin has 27 repositories available. Follow their code on GitHub.

webResultsPreview.title: GitHub - modelcontextprotocol/servers: Model Context Protocol Servers
webResultsPreview.snippet: Base Free USDC Transfer - Send USDC on Base for free using Claude AI! Built with Coinbase CDP. Basic Memory - Local-first knowledge management system that builds a semantic graph from Markdown files, enabling persistent memory across conversations with LLMs.

content: Can you exclude .DS_Store files from any future pulls?

Yes‚ÄîI‚Äôll exclude .DS_Store files from all future FileTree listings and reports.

## TL;DR
- I‚Äôll omit .DS_Store everywhere going forward.

## Optional repo hygiene (if you want it later)
- Add these to a .gitignore to keep them out of commits:
  ```
  .DS_Store
  ._*
  .Spotlight-V100
  .Trashes
  ```
- Or set a global ignore file and include the same patterns:
  ```
  git config --global core.excludesfile ~/.gitignore_global
  ```

If you want me to add a .gitignore to the Coin repo, say the word and I‚Äôll prepare the edit.
Yes, please include inside .gitignore. Thanks!

I‚Äôll add a .gitignore at the repo root that ignores common macOS files: .DS_Store, ._*, .Spotlight-V100, and .Trashes.

## TL;DR
- Creating .gitignore with macOS cruft ignored.

## Contents to add
- .DS_Store
- ._*
- .Spotlight-V100
- .Trashes

Applying now.

<TASKS>
{
  "tasks": [
    {
      "type": "create_file",
      "path": ".gitignore",
      "content": "# Ignore macOS system files\n.DS_Store\n._*\n.Spotlight-V100\n.Trashes\n"
    }
  ]
}
</TASKS>
